isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AUTOMATIC POSITIVE LOCKING TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS (NOSPIN/DETROIT LOCKER) - REASSEMBLE

step1.para: Lay the ring gear and flanged half of the differential support case on a bench with the bearing end of the case hub down and the inner case facing upward. BE SURE NO THRUST WASHERS ARE INSIDE THE CASE.
Place the ground hub of a side gear into the bore of the case. Be sure the side gear will rotate freely in the case.
Assemble one spring, spring retainer and driven clutch assembly.

note.para: Assembly procedures will differ depending upon the style of components used.

step2.para: Assemble spring retainer over the side gear splines with the retaining lip pointed up. It should seat against the side gear shoulder.
Place spring over the side gear spline and against the retainer lip with the smaller diameter of the spring against the retainer ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Place Spring Over Side Gear Spline

step2.para: Assemble driven clutch assembly over the spring with the teeth up ( Figure 5).
Assemble spring over the inner hub of the side gear and against the spring seat of the side gear.
Place the cupped section of the spring retainer over the spring ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Place Cupped Section of Spring Retainer Over Spring

step2.para: Assemble driven clutch over the spring retainer with the teeth up.

note.para: Verify that the spring is functioning freely by compressing the driven clutch over the side gear splines. Be sure the spring is not binding, that the coils do not overlap and that there is good contact between the end coil and the spring retainer when the driven clutch and side gear splines are fully meshed.

step1.para: Position the spider assembly or central driver assembly over the driven clutch assembly.

important.para: Be sure the slot in the holdout ring is properly aligned over the long tooth of the spider ( Figure 7and Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Be Sure Slot in Holdout Ring is Properly Aligned Over Long Tooth of Spider
Figure 8. Be Sure Slot in Holdout Ring is Properly Aligned Over Long Tooth of Spider

step1.para: Position the other driven clutch assembly on the spider assembly.

important.para: Be sure the slot in the holdout ring is properly aligned over the long tooth of the spider ( Figure 7and Figure 8).

step1.para: Assemble the other retainer, spring and side gear as previously indicated.
Mount the plain case half over the side gear and compress the springs. Be sure the side gear splines are completely meshed with the driven clutch splines.
Hold the case halves firmly together with the punch marks aligned. Install the case bolts.

warning.para: Do not release hand pressure until two or more bolts are in place and spring pressure has been overcome. Failure to heed this warning can cause injury.

step1.para: Tighten case bolts to the torque specified by International/axle manufacturer. Check to be certain of a snug fit between the two case halves at all points and between the trunnion mounts in the case and the spider trunnions. Bolt the ring gear to the NoSPIN differential and case assembly in the way recommended by International/axle manufacturer ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Bolt Ring Gear to NoSPIN Differential and Case Assembly

step1.para: Follow International's/axle manufacturer's instructions for re-installation of the ring gear and differential assembly into the axle carrier.
